item.description:
UPDATE: Rain date will be the next day, Sun. 11/7/10. We hope it doesn't rain, but if you can't make Sat. please consider stopping by on Sunday. This is an easy-breezy project and the tulips will bloom in spring for years to come!! Your friends and family are welcome too!


WE REMEMBER LAUREN TISBERT: We have done our best to console and support our friend Susan Tisbert following the passing of her beloved daughter, Lauren, in September.

THE PLAN: Lauren's favorite flowers are tulips. It would be lovely to create a garden of tulips ringing around a favorite tree on Susan's lawn. After a long cold winter will come the warmth and color of Spring! How nice to look forward to the blooming of tulips planted by friends, in honor and rememberance of Lauren!

WE NEED: PEOPLE to participate, give advice, and have fun!! Consider inviting family and friends as your guests!! Please bring a bag or two of tulips bulbs, and/or a bag of topsoil. Both of these items can be purchased at Home Depot or Lowes. Not expensive, and we need plenty of both!
If you have a bulb planter, bring that too!

THE REST: Susan needs help with raking her leaves, so we want to do this too. Have a rake or a leaf blower? Bring them! (ps...I'm trying to keep up with them, so shouldn't be bad, suz ;)

THE FUN: We will have a potluck day, so please bring something to share. Susan will have her BBQ available. A bonfire may be possible, weather permitting and she has a horseshoe pit. (I will supply beer/water/soda, pizza and salad...suz)

PARKING: Park in Susan's driveway or along Keyes Hill Road but on-street parking is only allowed on Susan's side of the street.

WHAT TO BRING:
1) A chair
2) Tulip bulbs or topsoil or BOTH. A bulb planter or small spade, if you have one.
3) Food to share and BYOBeverage please.
4) Rake, leafblower.
5) A pretty garden ornament? Little statues, pretty stones, any creative touches you may wish to add.

I'M ALMOST DONE: Please come even if you only have an hour to spare, or can stay longer.
Post any ideas because SUGGESTIONS and FEEDBACK are welcome!
And remember: "MANY HANDS MAKE LIGHT WORK"

Rain date will be Sunday, November 7th between 10-11am arrival so we can watch the Pat's game at 1pm.

group.name: Fun in So. NH and Merrimack Valley

item.name: Let's create a Tulip Garden for Lauren!
